answers.answer: Hello.Are you in the age range where you could think of Diabetes? Was there any blood sugar estimation done? Diabetic neuropathy has similar symptoms.If diabetes has already been ruled out, you may think of going in for a nerve conduction study. There are possibilities of this being due to a peripheral neuropathy.Do you have any other systemic illness?Regards

Hi! You may also want to have your neck checked I had similar feelings a while ago, and it was found that I had a pinched nerve in my neck that was giving me the sensations of my limbs being "asleep" like 24/7. I was actually afraid to hold anything important because I was afraid I'd drop it because I couldn't get a real grip on it.good luck!

question: I have started about aweek ago with tingling in my hand and feet also feeling as though my legs will not carry me,  I feel as though my nerves want to shake,I have been to the doctor so many times the first time I went to a specialist and he found a deficiancy of B12 i had injections and now me B12 is right but now I have started with the symptons very bad it stops me from sleeping at night I just feel as though I can't sit still. I have had quiet a lot of blood work done a full blood count, thyroid, B12 and a liver function test all came back normal, it is realy starting to interfere with my life and I am getting very worried.Has any one got any ideas what the doctor must look for.
title: Tingling in feet legs and hands and arms
